snippet: Europe’s top aviation safety agency called on national governments to better enable international regulators and airlines to assess the risks of flying over conflict zones.
abstract: European Aviation Safety Agency, in wake of downing of Malaysia Airlines jet over Ukraine in July, urges national governments to share intelligence data with aviation authorities; says greater coordination will better enable international regulators and airlines to assess the risks of flying over conflict zones.
lead_paragraph: Europe’s top aviation safety agency called on national governments to better enable international regulators and airlines to assess the risks of flying over conflict zones.

headline.main: E.U. Urges Sharing Data to Avert Air Disasters
headline.print_headline: E.U. Urges Sharing Data to Avert Air Disasters
